Title: Vegan Gluten-Free Lasagna

Ingredients.name: Gluten-free lasagna noodles
Ingredients.glycemic_flag: ⚠️ HIGH GI - Consider zucchini noodles instead
Ingredients.notes: Most gluten-free pasta has a high glycemic index due to rice or corn flour

Ingredients.name: Marinara sauce
Ingredients.glycemic_flag: ⚠️ MODERATE GI - Check for added sugar
Ingredients.notes: Choose low-sugar marinara or make your own

Instructions: Cook gluten-free lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.

For the tofu ricotta: In a food processor, blend drained tofu, soaked cashews (drained), nutritional yeast, 2 minced garlic cloves, lemon juice, salt, and pepper until creamy. Stir in chopped basil and spinach.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté remaining garlic, zucchini, and mushrooms until tender (about 5-7 minutes). Season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
To assemble: Spread 240ml (1 cup) marinara sauce on the bottom of a 23x33cm (9x13 inch) baking dish.
Layer 4 lasagna noodles over the sauce.
Spread half of the tofu ricotta mixture over the noodles.
Add half of the sautéed vegetables.
Pour 240ml (1 cup) marinara sauce over vegetables.
Repeat layers: noodles, remaining ricotta, remaining vegetables, and remaining sauce.
Top with final layer of 4 noodles and remaining marinara sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
Type_2_Modifications: RECOMMENDED: Replace gluten-free noodles with thinly sliced zucchini or eggplant 'noodles' to dramatically lower the glycemic load
Use a sugar-free marinara sauce or make your own with fresh tomatoes
Increase the proportion of vegetables to noodles (use extra spinach, zucchini, mushrooms)
Add extra protein with lentils or chickpeas in the vegetable layer
Portion control: Stick to 1/8 of the recipe (one serving) paired with a large side salad

Substitutions.Lower Carb Version: Use spiralized zucchini or thinly sliced eggplant instead of pasta noodles (reduces net carbs to ~12g)
Substitutions.Cashew Alternative: Use blanched almonds or silken tofu for the ricotta if cashews are unavailable
Substitutions.Faster Prep: Use store-bought vegan ricotta instead of making cashew ricotta

High_GI_Ingredients: Marinara sauce if it contains added sugar (GI: 45-50)
Nutritional_Notes.Blood_Sugar_Impact: Medium-High when made with pasta noodles. Can be reduced to Low if using vegetable 'noodles' instead.
Nutritional_Notes.Fiber_Content: Good fiber from vegetables and nuts helps moderate blood sugar response
Nutritional_Notes.Protein_Content: Adequate protein from tofu and cashews helps stabilize blood sugar
